clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Trial of Qigong for Patients in Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Observational Trial of Chaoyi Fanhuan Qigong as a Complementary Practice in Patients Receiving Treatment at a Tertiary-care Pain Management Unit: Part II

brief_summary.textblock: This observational study documented outcomes resulting from qigong practice as a complementary self-care practice. All subjects continued with their usual medical care. Recruitment was passive, and participants consisted of those who encountered the practice as part of an earlier clinical trial, or entered the program prior to the observational period (posted information, word-of-mouth), or entered during the observational period (posted information).

primary_outcome.description: Brief Pain Inventory, short form. Minimum is 0 (no pain), maximum is 10 (most pain)

secondary_outcome.description: Profile of Mood States. Minimum is 30 (less depressed), maximum is 150 (more depressed)
Short Form-12 item, Version 2 (SF-12V2). Minimum is 12 (lowest Quality of life), maximum is 56 (best Quality of life)
Pittsburg Sleep Quality Index. Minimum is 0 (best sleep), maximum is 21 (poor sleep).
Chronic Fatigue Scale. Minimum is 0 (no fatigue), maximum is 42 (most fatigue).

arm_group.description: Patients in this arm participated in qigong as part of their treatment at the Pain Management Unit
Patients attend the pain management unit but do not undertake qigong practice.

intervention.description: Patients of the Pain Management Unit either experience usual treatment, or usual treatment plus qigong practice.

study_pop.textblock: Patients attending the Pain Management Unit for management of chronic pain.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Those undertaking qigong practice as a complementary self-care practice at the Pain Management Unit
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
